title: Hindustani - John (Print)
description: Caribbean Hindustani is an Indo-Aryan language spoken by Indo-Caribbeans and the Indo-Caribbean diaspora. It is mainly based on the Bhojpuri and Awadhi dialects. These Hindustani dialects were spoken by the Indians who came as immigrants to the Caribbean from India as indentured laborers. It is closely related to Fiji Hindi and the Bhojpuri-Hindustani spoken in Mauritius and South Africa.

language.name: Caribbean Hindustani
language.area: Coastal region. Also in Guyana, Netherlands, Trinidad and Tobago.
